fields.headline: Somewhere in Britain
fields.bodyText: Before the Cavern The Quarrymen, a washboard, guitar and tea-chest bass group formed by John Lennon and friends when they were at school, and skiffle - the music they played - form the theme of a new exhibition about to open in Liverpool. The Beatles Story, Britannia Pavilion, Albert Dock. May 16-October 1. 10am-6pm. £7.95 adults, £5.45 concessions/children, £19 families. 0151-709 1963. Oh yes it is! Samuel Pepys first saw Mr Punch, manipulated by an Italian puppet master, in 1662 at London's Covent Garden. The May Fayre, held annually to celebrate the event, takes place there tomorrow with Punch and Judy performers from all over Britain. St Paul's Church. 10.30am- 5.30pm. Free. Covent Garden Life Optical illusions Three-dimensional paintings by locally born artist Patrick Hughes are on show in Birmingham. The 15 works appear to move as you look at them, challenging your sense of balance. Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery, Chamberlain Square. Until August 11. 10am-5pm (opens 10.30am Fridays, 12.30pm Saturdays). Free. 0121-303 2834 , Birmingham Museums and Art Made in Kent Wine, cheese, pickles and sausages are among the offerings from some 40 local producers at Leeds Castle, near Maidstone, today. Plus a jazz band. Festival of English Food and Wine. Castle is 7 miles east of Maidstone and signposted from junction 8 on M20. Today and tomorrow, 10am-5pm. Included in castle/grounds admission prices: £11 adults, £9.50 seniors/students, £7.50 children (4-15), £32 families (2 adults/up to 3 children). 01622 765400. Runners and riders Man races horse in a 22-mile marathon across the Brecon Beacons next Saturday. Runners get a 15-minute head start. Llanwrtyd Wells. 11am start. First finishers cross the line just over two hours later. Free. Llanwrtyd Wells tourist information centre, tel: 01591 610828. Man-v-Horse Is there anybody out there? Is there life on other planets? Astronomer Sir Patrick Moore talks in Derby on Wednesday. Assembly Rooms. May 15, 7.30pm. £8-£10 adults, £7 concessions. 01332 255800. Nottingham blues Blues singer Charles "Wigg" Walker, a native of Nashville Tennessee who has worked with James Brown, is at Nottingham's Old Vic on Thursday. May 16, 7.30pm. £8.50/£7.50 concessions in advance, £9.50/£8.50 on the door. 0115 9419419, Nottingham Events Best of Perth Chamber music and jazz concerts, stand-up comedy and Japanese Taiko drumming are some of the events at this year's Perth Festival of the Arts. City Hall, Perth Theatre and other venues. May 15-26. For full programme, times and admission prices, call 01738 472706.
